'''Adrian Joseph Mariappa''' (born 3 October 1986) is a professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Defender (association football)|defender]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]].
He progressed through Watford's youth academy, and started playing for the first team in the [[2005–06 Watford F.C. season|2005–06 season]]. Although primarily a centre back, he spent some of his early professional career at right back due to competition for places in the middle. In his first spell at Watford, he made 247 first team appearances, including 19 in the [[Premier League]]. This included a run of 113 consecutive league appearances, the fourth longest streak in Watford's history. Mariappa captained Watford at under-18, reserve and first-team levels, and was the club's vice captain in his final few years at [[Vicarage Road]]. Mariappa accepted his first call up to [[Jamaica national football team|Jamaica's international team]] in May 2012.<ref name=jamaica/> He won his first cap against [[Guyana national football team|Guyana]] later that month, and transferred to [[Premier League]] side [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] in July 2012. He made 29 league appearances for the club before joining Premier League side Crystal Palace in September 2013, following Reading's relegation to the [[Football League Championship|Championship.]] Returning to Watford before the 2016–17 season, Mariappa made 7 league appearances that season.
==Career==
===Watford=== [[file:Adrian Mariappa 2 (cropped).jpg|thumb|left|Mariappa with Watford in 2011]] Born in nearby [[Harrow, London|Harrow]], Mariappa started his career in Watford's youth system. He captained the club's under-18 side during their [[FA Youth Cup]] quarter final against [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]],<ref>[http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~641431,00.html "Watford Yth 0–2 Tottenham Yth"]. Watford F.C. 17 March 2005. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref> and later captained the reserve team.<ref>[http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~1096429,00.html "Watford 2 Aldershot 1"]. Watford F.C. 21 August 2007. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref>
Mariappa was selected as an unused substitute in Watford's last league game of the [[2004-05 Watford F.C. season|2004–05 season]].<ref name=wfcpro>{{cite web |url=http://www.watfordfc.com/page/ProfilesDetail/0,,10400~33429,00.html |title=Profiles:Adrian Mariappa |publisher=Watford F.C |accessdate=28 October 2009 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091124192615/http://www.watfordfc.com/page/ProfilesDetail/0%2C%2C10400~33429%2C00.html |archivedate=24 November 2009 |deadurl=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> After signing his first professional contract with the club that summer,<ref>[http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~661559,00.html "Squad rebuilding starts"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120826083122/http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0%2C%2C10400~661559%2C00.html |date=26 August 2012 }}. Watford F.C. 5 May 2005. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref> Mariappa made his first team debut in a [[Football League Cup|League Cup]] match against [[Notts County]] on 23 August 2005, playing 90 minutes in a 3–1 Watford win.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/teams/w/watford/9379292.stm "Adrian Mariappa handed new Watford deal"]. BBC Sport. 28 January 2011. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~703971,00.html|title=Academy Trio's debut delight|publisher=Watford F.C|accessdate=28 October 2009|date=24 August 2005|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120312124223/http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~703971,00.html|archive-date=12 March 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> He made another cup start against [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] in the 3rd round. During the [[2005-06 Watford F.C. season|2005–06]] season he also made three league appearances, including a clean sheet in his first league start, against [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] on the final day of the regular season.<ref name=soccerbase/> Mariappa did not play any of Watford's play-off games, but was an unused substitute in the [[2006 Football League Championship play-off Final|final]], in which the team won promotion to the [[Premier League]].<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/4771857.stm "Leeds 0–3 Watford"]. BBC Sport. 21 May 2006. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref>
Watford started their [[2006-07 Watford F.C. season|2006–07]] Premier League campaign at [[Everton F.C.|Everton]], with Mariappa starting in central defence in place of first-team regular [[Jay DeMerit]]. He was substituted at half-time, and, aside from a League Cup appearance against [[Accrington Stanley F.C.|Accrington Stanley]], did not make another first-team appearance until December 2006, when in an away match at [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] he came on for the injured [[James Chambers (English footballer)|James Chambers]] at right-back. He continued in that position, playing regularly for the rest of the season.<ref name=soccerbase>{{cite web|url=http://www.soccerbase.com/players_details.sd?playerid=41227|title=Adrian Mariappa:All time playing career|publisher=Centurycomm|work=Soccerbase|accessdate=28 October 2009| archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20091008234658/http://www.soccerbase.com/players_details.sd?playerid=41227| archivedate= 8 October 2009 | deadurl= no}}</ref><ref>[http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-433421/Mariappa-Its-good-talk.html "Mariappa: It's good to talk"]. ''[[Mail Online]]''. 2 February 2007. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref>
With Watford back in the Championship for [[2007-08 Watford F.C. season|2007–08]], Mariappa found himself largely on the substitute bench, making 13 league starts and 3 in other competitions, as Watford again reached the play-offs.<ref name=soccerbase/> By contrast, he started 45 games in all competitions in the [[2008-09 Watford F.C. season|2008–09]] season, under the management of [[Aidy Boothroyd]], [[Malky Mackay]] and latterly [[Brendan Rodgers]], and scored his first senior goal for Watford in a 3–1 defeat at [[Wolverhampton Wanderers F.C.|Wolves]] on 31 January 2009.<ref name=soccerbase/><ref>{{cite news |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/7856707.stm |title=Wolves 3–1 Watford |publisher=[[BBC]] |date=31 January 2009 |accessdate=1 September 2009}}</ref> At the end of the season he signed a two-year extension to his contract.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~1649390,00.html|title=Mariappa deal is signed and sealed|publisher=Watford F.C|accessdate=28 October 2009|date=14 May 2009|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120312124235/http://www.watfordfc.com/page/NewsDetail/0,,10400~1649390,00.html|archive-date=12 March 2012|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
In the absence of injured captain [[Jay DeMerit]], Mariappa skippered Watford for the first time on 12 September 2009, in a 1–0 victory at [[Vicarage Road]] against [[Barnsley F.C.|Barnsley]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordfc.com/page/MatchReport/0,,10400~48719,00.html|title=Watford 1–0 Barnsley|publisher=Watford F.C|date=12 September 2009}}</ref> He retained the captaincy during DeMerit's absence, and scored his second senior goal in October 2009, on his 100th professional appearance.<ref>Smith, Frank (30 October 2009). [http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/archive/2009/10/30/Sport+%28sport%29/4710275.Watford_skipper_backs_Lloyd_Doyley_to_lift_roof_off_Vicarage_Road/ "Watford skipper backs Lloyd Doyley to lift roof off Vicarage Road"]. ''Watford Observer''. pp. 70–71.<!--was featured both in the hard copy and online--> Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref> Watford finished the [[2009–10 Watford F.C. season|2009–10 season]] 16th in the Championship; Mariappa was the only player to start each of the club's games in the Football League, FA Cup and League Cup.<ref name=soccerbase2>[http://www.soccerbase.com/teams/team.sd?team_id=2741&comp_id=2&teamTabs=stats "Watford: Player appearances"]. ''Soccerbase.'' Centurycomm. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref><ref>[http://www.statto.com/football/teams/watford/2009-2010/results Watford 2009–2010: Results"]. ''Statto.com''. Tony Brown. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref> [[2010–11 Watford F.C. season|2010–11]] followed a similar pattern to the previous campaign; Mariappa started every game for which he was available,<ref name=talksport/> and was one of Watford's six scorers in the team's 6–1 away win against Millwall.<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/sport1/hi/football/eng_div_1/8997907.stm "Millwall 1–6 Watford"]. BBC Sport. 18 September 2010. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref> He was also appointed as the club's vice captain during the season.<ref name=talksport/> However, Mariappa was sent off for the first time in his career on 19 March 2011, in a 2–1 defeat to Middlesbrough.<ref name=soccerbase/> The resulting suspension ended Mariappa's run of 113 consecutive league appearances, the fourth highest in Watford's history.<ref name=talksport>[http://www.talksport.co.uk/magazine/features/2012-01-30/talksport-transfer-spotlight-facts-stats-and-video-arsenal-and-newcastle-target-adrian-mariappa "talkSPORT Transfer Spotlight: facts, stats and video of Arsenal and Newcastle target Adrian Mariappa"]. [[TalkSPORT]]. 30 January 2012. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref>
Mariappa continued to play in the [[2011–12 Watford F.C. season|2011–12 season]] under new manager [[Sean Dyche]]. He was the focus of transfer speculation during the January 2012 transfer window when Watford received a number of bids for him from Premier League clubs. Three bids from [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] were rejected;<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2012/jan/31/newcastle-watford-adrian-mariappa-pardew?newsfeed=true | location=London | work=The Guardian | title=Newcastle in final bid for Watford's Adrian Mariappa, says Alan Pardew | date=31 January 2012}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thisislocallondon.co.uk/sport/football/footballnews/9494544.Pardew_denies_low_bid_was_to_unsettle_Mariappa/r/?action=complain&cid=10037474|title=Newcastle United boss denies claims low bid aimed to unsettle Watford defender Adrian Mariappa|work=This Is Local London|accessdate=6 February 2012|date=26 January 2012|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130505070034/http://www.thisislocallondon.co.uk/sport/football/footballnews/9494544.Pardew_denies_low_bid_was_to_unsettle_Mariappa/r/?action=complain&cid=10037474|archive-date=5 May 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref> an offer from [[Wigan Athletic F.C.|Wigan Athletic]] was accepted, but Mariappa rejected a move.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www1.skysports.com/football/news/11678/7468551/Mariappa-rejects-Wigan-chance|title=Mariappa rejects Wigan chance | work=Sky Sports|accessdate=17 April 2012}}</ref> He stayed at the club until the following summer, and his good form saw players and fans vote him 2011–12 [[Watford F.C. Player of the Season]].<ref>Matthews, Anthony (28 April 2012). [http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/9676944.Mariappa_wins_Player_of_the_Season_award/ "Mariappa wins Player of the Season"]. ''Watford Observer''. Retrieved 30 April 2012. Full article printed in the ''Watford Observer''. p. 62. 27 April 2012.</ref>
===Reading=== [[File:Adrian Mariappa (cropped).png|thumb|upright|Adrian Mariappa on the football pitch wearing Reading's 2012–13 away kit|Mariappa playing for [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] in 2013.]] On 17 July 2012, it was announced that Mariappa had joined [[Reading F.C.|Reading]] on a three-year deal for an undisclosed fee.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~2851710,00.html |title=Mariappa signs from Watford |date=18 July 2012 |accessdate=19 July 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120719022710/http://www.readingfc.co.uk/page/NewsDetail/0,,10306~2851710,00.html |archive-date=19 July 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Media estimates of the transfer fee ranged from £2m to £3m.<ref>{{cite news |last=Smith |first=Frank |date=17 July 2012 |url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/9821317.Reading_confirm_Mariappa_signing/ |title=Reading confirm Mariappa signing |newspaper=Watford Observer |accessdate=19 July 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last=Fordham |first=Jonny |date=16 July 2012 |url=http://www.getreading.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/adrian-mariappa-set-join-reading-4198899 |title=Adrian Mariappa set to join Reading FC in time for Portugal |newspaper=Reading Post |accessdate=30 September 2013}}</ref>
===Crystal Palace=== Mariappa signed for newly promoted Premier League club [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]] on a three-year contract for an undisclosed fee on 2 September 2013.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/23934881|title=Transfer deadline day: Adrian Mariappa signs for Crystal Palace|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 September 2013|accessdate=2 September 2013}}</ref>
At the end of his three-year deal, Mariappa discussed a move to [[Scottish Championship]] winners [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]],<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.thescottishsun.co.uk/scotsol/homepage/sport/7201777/Rangers-eye-move-for-out-of-contract-Crystal-Palace-defender-Adrian-Mariappa.html|title=Rangers eye move for out-of-contract Crystal Palace defender Adrian Mariappa|publisher=The Scottish Sun|date=19 June 2016|accessdate=19 June 2016|first=Derek|last=McGregor}}</ref> after it was confirmed on 13 June 2016 that he would be released by Crystal Palace on expiry of his contract.<ref>{{cite web|title=Six Players Released By Crystal Palace|url=https://www.cpfc.co.uk/news/2016/june/six-players-released-by-crystal-palace/|website=cpfc.co.uk|date=13 June 2016|accessdate=20 June 2016}}</ref>
===Return to Watford=== On 30 August 2016, Mariappa re-joined [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] on a three-year deal after a four-year absence.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Return Of The Mapps |url=https://www.watfordfc.com/club/return-mapps |publisher=Watford F.C. |date=30 August 2016 |accessdate=30 August 2016}}</ref>
Mariappa made his 250th Watford start with a Man of the Match performance against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]] in a 1–0 win on 3 March 2018.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Mariappa "Massive For Us" |url=https://www.watfordfc.com/teams/first-team/mariappa-massive-us |publisher=Watford F.C. |date=3 March 2018 |accessdate=5 March 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Mariappa's father is [[Fijians|Fijian]]<ref>[http://www.oceaniafootball.com/ofc/News/ViewArticle/tabid/125/Article/1a59a391-7971-478c-9406-1f161f0707de/language/en-US/Default.aspx "Star with Fijian roots sees red"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140503065345/http://www.oceaniafootball.com/ofc/News/ViewArticle/tabid/125/Article/1a59a391-7971-478c-9406-1f161f0707de/language/en-US/Default.aspx |date=3 May 2014 }}. [[Oceania Football Confederation]]. 22 March 2011. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref> making Adrian<!--first name necessary due to the number of Mariappas mentioned in this sentence--> eligible to play international football for that [[Fiji national football team|country]].<ref>[https://www.fifa.com/mm/document/affederation/generic/01/09/75/14/fifa_statutes_072008_en.pdf "VII. Eligibility to play for association teams"]. [[FIFA]]. May 2008. Retrieved 17 April 2012.</ref> In late 2010 he was named by the [[Fiji Football Association]] in the 50-member national training squad to prepare for the [[2011 Pacific Games]] in New Caledonia, but did not take up the place.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.fijitimes.com/story.aspx?id=162728|title=English defender in national squad|publisher=The Fiji Times Online|date=25 December 2010|access-date=24 July 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006084114/http://www.fijitimes.com/story.aspx?id=162728|archive-date=6 October 2014|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Both of Mariappa's maternal grandparents are from Jamaica, and in 2012 Mariappa accepted a call up to the Jamaica squad, for a friendly against Guyana.<ref name=jamaica>Smith, Frank (14 May 2012). [http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/9704371.Watford_duo_called_up_by_Jamaica/ "Watford duo called up by Jamaica"]. ''Watford Observer''. Retrieved 14 May 2012.</ref> His first match in an international competition came on 9 June 2012, in a 2–1 World Cup qualifying win against Guatemala.<ref>[https://int.soccerway.com/players/adrian-mariappa/2546/ "Jamaica: A. Mariappa"]. Soccerway. Retrieved 19 July 2012.</ref>
